extendedInfo.description: Burn Note is a mobile messaging app where all messages self-destruct after reading. Messages are displayed using the patent pending Spotlight system which is copy-resistant, prevents screenshots, and blocks people nearby from viewing your conversation. When the recipient opens a message on Burn Note a countdown timer is started which destroys the message automatically after completion. Burn Note securely deletes all message data from the servers and the app on both the sender's and receiver's phone or computer. Once a Burn Note has been deleted it cannot be viewed again. Messages can be sent to other Burn Note users, to email addresses, or you can get a link to use anywhere. Non-registered users can access the Burn Note website as guests to participate in a conversation they have been invited to. The goal of Burn Note is to allow online communication at the same level of intimacy as in-person conversation; more personal than sharing on a social site, sending email or using SMS.

reviews.title: It works
reviews.comment: It does exactly what it says it does. The problem is, people think it will send secret hidden encrypted messages or something via text. Think about, how\'s it supposed to do that, seriously? If it sent a text with your message, what\'s the point? It sends out a text saying go check your burn note for a message essentially.
reviews.author: Jesse Staab

reviews.title: Perfect app! But one note...
reviews.comment: Idk why people keep saying this doesn\'t send text. It sends text messages, appears smoothly, rarely have an issue with it, and I\'ve gotten all my friend hooked on it. Excellent app and a most have. Just one thing. I wish when someone messaged me it would keep the people that I have talked to on a list without me having to add them individually to my contact list. That is all.
reviews.author: Yeah Buddy

reviews.title: Awesome app
reviews.comment: Its almost outta a movie. Secret messages that are viewed and deleted, both parties covered. Awesome I say
reviews.author: Samson Akisanya

reviews.title: Text not showing up, makes unusable.
reviews.comment: Awesome concept, app needs work. When trying to type a message, no text shows up and nothing is sent. I have reinstalled several times, the problem persists.
reviews.author: Gregory Prouty

reviews.title: Awesome app, use it all the time
reviews.comment: It\'s perfect for having off-the-record conversations. I use it for sending passwords and CC numbers to people. Plus, the spotlight view is kind of awesome... really good for reading messages on the train that you don\'t want people to glance over at.
reviews.author: Peter Frasca

reviews.title: Really good
reviews.comment: The description is NOT all about texting, are simply wrong and have read wrong.  Works very well, however just two things could be slightly improved. I think that the layout and interface could be in time improved something I enjoy is simplicity and slickness with apps I use often. Another thing, I found a way to take screenshots, using a floating browser app called Overskreen. I think the developers may need a little bit more coding to do. Still the concept and app itself I couldn\'t recommend more. 5/5
reviews.author: himyname mathisawesome

reviews.title: Tablet Version?
reviews.comment: Love the app but it would be nice to have a tablet version to fix the layout inconsistencies.  Otherwise, a very useful, creative app.
reviews.author: Kevin Sebesky

reviews.title: Great for sharing secrets
reviews.comment: I can\'t pass notes in my high school class with txts anymore cause my moms found them on my phone lol. Now I use burnnote. It rulz.
reviews.author: Lee Azzarello

reviews.title: Thought it was meant to be about texts??!
reviews.comment: All a pile o crap that is about sending emails,and NOT about texts,and you also have to sign up!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Text
reviews.comment: I thought it was for texting
reviews.author: Jeb Tral

reviews.title: Excellent app and excellent dev
reviews.comment: I love the website and it is great to have it on my phone. And very responsive developers. TA!
reviews.author: Georgette Taylor

reviews.title: A great way to send private messages
reviews.comment: I have only started testing this app recently but it seems to work brilliantly. It is the perfect way to send and receive private messages whether you use the app or the website. You don\'t even need to have an account to read messages sent to you.
reviews.author: Philip Stone

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work when sent to text
reviews.comment: A text shows up without a link. Uninstalling!
reviews.author: David Chaney

reviews.title: Timed out!
reviews.comment: After downloading the app on my Android I already had a burn note account for my e mail and had forgotten the password when I tried to go through the steps to retrieve the password the app continuously timed out never letting me inside the app so for now my rating is a single star mainly for effort

reviews.title: Simple and secure
reviews.comment: People can\'t screen shot your messages with this. Seems really secure way of chatting
reviews.author: Aaron Robbins

reviews.title: Nice first to hear about it
reviews.author: Mike tawhai

reviews.title: If only it worked for text
reviews.comment: If it worked for text messages; Had the ability to integrate with messaging platform on settings like time(ie at 10pm all messages until 2am are sent with burnote settings) the app could be legendary...until then I have uninstalled
reviews.author: Anthony Scatamacchia
